Class DataStore

java.lang.Object
src.DataStore
public class DataStore extends Object
Singleton in-memory repository for application data.

This class maintains lists of students, company representatives, career center staff, internships, and internship applications. On first access, the singleton loads initial data from CSV files found under src/csvFiles. It also provides convenience methods to find entities by id and to persist the current in-memory state back to CSV files.

Usage: call getInstance() to obtain the singleton instance, then use provided getters, finders, adders, and save methods to operate on the data.

    • saveStudents

      public void saveStudents(String filename)
      Save the current list of students to a CSV file. Overwrites the file if it exists.
      Parameters:
      filename - path to write the students CSV to

    • saveStaff

      public void saveStaff(String filename)
      Save the current list of career center staff to a CSV file.
      Parameters:
      filename - path to write the staff CSV to

    • saveCompanyReps

      public void saveCompanyReps(String filename)
      Save company representatives to a CSV file. The CSV includes the approval status column and stored passwords.
      Parameters:
      filename - path to write the company reps CSV to

    • saveInternships

      public void saveInternships(String filename)
      Save the current list of internships to a CSV file. Includes all internship details, applicants, and status information.
      Parameters:
      filename - path to write the internships CSV to

    • saveApplications

      public void saveApplications(String filename)
      Save the current list of internship applications to a CSV file. Persists student decisions, company decisions, and withdrawal status for each application.
      Parameters:
      filename - path to write the applications CSV to

    • saveAll

      public void saveAll()
      Convenience method to save all entities (students, staff, company representatives, internships, and applications) to their respective CSV files in one operation.
